      Represents the current index of the Result.

    • Field Detail

      • currentIndex

        private int currentIndex
        Represents the current index of the Result. Used to reduce the amount of computation required.

      • FILE_NAME

        private final java.lang.String FILE_NAME
        Represents the constant file name that the results are stored. If changed here it will read/write from that file without error.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • results

        private java.util.ArrayList<Result> results
        Represents the previous results from the text file.

      • errorOccured

        private boolean errorOccured
        Indicates if an error has occured in the reading of the text file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ResultStorage

        public ResultStorage()
        creates a list of all Results taken from the results file

    • Method Detail

      • isIndex

        public boolean isIndex(int index)
        Checks to see if that combination of results has ever occured before
        Parameters:
        index - indicates the current index created from the combination of results
        Returns:
        return true if that index has ever been visited before, returns false if not

      • getResultRock

        public int getResultRock(int index)
        Finds out how many times the user has choosen rock on this combination of results
        Parameters:
        index - indicates the current index generated from the combination of results
        Returns:
        returns the amount of times the user has choosen rock, returns 0 if this is the first time the user has had this combination of results.

      • getResultPaper

        public int getResultPaper(int index)
        Finds out how many times the user has choosen paper on this combination of results
        Parameters:
        index - indicates the current index generated from the combination of results
        Returns:
        returns the amount of times the user has choosen paper, returns 0 if this is the first time the user has had this combination of results.

      • getResultScissor

        public int getResultScissor(int index)
        Finds out how many times the user has choosen scissors on this combination of results
        Parameters:
        index - indicates the current index generated from the combination of results
        Returns:
        returns the amount of times the user has choosen scissors, returns 0 if this is the first time the user has had this combination of results.

      • addResult

        public void addResult(int round,
             int choice,
             int result)
        Either adds a new entry to the result file, or updates it according to the users choice.
        Parameters:
        round - signifies the current round in the current game
        choice - signifies the users choice, 1 = rock, 2 = paper, 3 = scissors
        result - signifies if the user won, lost or drew

      • updateIndex

        private void updateIndex(int result)
        Updates the current index depending on what the result of the last round was.
        Parameters:
        result - indicates the result of the last round, 1 = lost, 2 = draw, 3 = win.

      • storeValues

        public void storeValues()
        Sorts all result values and then stores into the respective file if it exists, if not then creates a file.

      • sortData

        private java.util.ArrayList<Result> sortData(java.util.ArrayList<Result> input)
        Sorts the result values by their index values
        Parameters:
        input - indicates the list wanting to be sorted
        Returns:
        the ordered list

      • attemptFileReadAmount

        private int attemptFileReadAmount(java.util.Scanner fileScanner)
        Attempts to read an integer value from a file. Uses a NumberFormatException to see if a non-number value is passed if so then returns 0 and notifies that there was a bug
        Parameters:
        fileScanner - indicates the Scanner object connected to the File
        Returns:
        the integer value of the record, will be 0 if an error

      • fillData

        private void fillData()
        Populates the result list from the result file
